intro: Bauhinia albolutea, commonly known as the white-flowered bauhinia, is a deciduous leguminous plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, bipinnate leaves and showy, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen through symbiotic relationships with rhizobia bacteria. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its elegant appearance. The seeds are encased in a hard, woody pod that splits open when mature.
